body.p:
Camp Chase Ohio Prison no 1
August 19th 1862

The undersigned peacable citizens of Kentucky would respectfully, state to his Excellency and the Legislature of Ky, that they are held as prisoners at Camp Chase Ohio; having been arrested whilst purusing their legitimate business, without warrant and without legal authority, in vilolation of law and their civil and legal rights ^&^ forced out of the State of Ky and into this prison where we are now held

We are unlawfully held at this place, having always been law abiding citizens of the State of Ky. and have never committed an act of disloyalty against that State or the United States and we are aprised by the official that we can only regain our liberty, by proof establishing our innocence -- a principle unprecented and unknown to the law. --
We ask the charges preppreferedared against us, damand to be confronted by our accusers and a trial by our peers in persuance of the constitutions of Ky and that of the United States.

We therefore would call your Excellency's attention and the considerations of the Legislature to this matter and ask of your honor and that honorable body if they approve of these proceedings and to immediately take action for our release and to prevent such proceedings in the future
